title.narrative: WASH:Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) AND ENVIRONMENT SUSTAINABILITY

description.narrative: By 2021, UNICEF and partners in WCAR are better equipped to increase access and use of safe, sustainable and affordable drinking water services and basic sanitation facilities, and end open defecation, by the poorest and vulnerable populations in times of stability and crisis.New Element, which contributes to Disaster Risk Reduction, Sanitation, Water, Water (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2030, Every Child in WCAR lives in a predictable, safe and clean environment.

IRC INTERNATIONAL WATER AND SANITATION CENTRE

sector.narrative: WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, UNICEF and partners in WCAR are better equipped to increase access and use of safe, sustainable and affordable drinkingwater services and basic sanitation facilities, and end open defecation, by the poorest and vulnerable populations in times ofstability and crisis.New Element

description.narrative: Efforts in 2021 focused on (i) humanitarian actions with technical assistance, trainings and field visits, (ii) hygiene and ending open defecation (sanitation) through advocacy, technical assistance and partnerships, (iii) Climate change and risk management through the solar hub. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:07/02/2022

title.narrative: (2- Sanitation & Ending Open Defecation) Number of countries with a costed plan to end open defecation(55091)
